title: Half of all debit card payments are now contactless for the first time
text:
Half of all debit card payments are now contactless for the first time, according to figures from the banking trade body.

UK Finance published data on card transactions showing the tipping point had been reached, with 50pc of transactions, some 647 million payments, being made using the contactless facility.

For credit cards the figure was 35pc.

Gareth Shaw, of Which?, the consumer group, said the change had likely been driven by the uptake of contactless payment systems by transport networks, including the London Underground, and the “universality” of smart phones with digital payment functions.

However, he warned it was important that policymakers do not leave behind those who continue to rely on cash.
